Oh, the evil that George W. Bush hath done!

post_info.post_title: How Stupidity Became a Virtue in America

Yep, because we all know there were no stupid people before Bush, right? emoticon_rolleyes
 
 A lot of people believe Obama is different than Bush. That's pretty stupid, in my opinion.

Only the people who voted for Bush were stupid.
 
 We still don't know about Obama. At least he speaks English. Well.

Unless, of course, the teleprompter malfunctions. 
 
 YouTube - Barack Obama - Blithering ##### - w/ CNN Video
 
 Or, perhaps you would like a display of his knowledge of US states.
 
 YouTube - Obama Claims He's Visited 57 States
 
 Frankly, I don't really care how a president sounds. I care more about actual policies. In that regard, Obama is simply building a skyscraper on Bush's foundation.

Obama actually works for a living, as opposed to Bush who vacationed for a living.
 
 I know damned well and good that Obama knows something as basic as that there are 50 states and that he misspoke when he was tired. The man does put in his time on the job.
 
 For a change.

A lot of people believe Obama is different than Bush. That's pretty stupid, in my opinion.

 I agree. Bush had some poor policies, and Obama is continuing these poor policies...:xbanghead
 
 
Frankly, I don't really care how a president sounds. I care more about actual policies. In that regard, Obama is simply building a skyscraper on Bush's foundation.

 I would rather have a president that can speak well than have one who can't, but I would never base my vote on speaking skills. Obama isn't just building one skyscraper on Bush's foundation, he is building a whole city of them.
 
 
I know damned well and good that Obama knows something as basic as that there are 50 states and that he misspoke when he was tired. The man does put in his time on the job.

 Do you believe that Palin did not know Africa was a continent? I don't. I also don't believe Obama actually thought there were 57 states. How on earth he could misspeak like that so badly I don't know, but come on people. If he was born in the United States he is going to know how many states there are.

.... Do you believe that Palin did not know Africa was a continent? I don't. I also don't believe Obama actually thought there were 57 states. How on earth he could misspeak like that so badly I don't know, but come on people. If he was born in the United States he is going to know how many states there are.

 Palin is very poorly and rather spottily educated. I understand that she bounced around in a number of not very impressive colleges before she finally was able to put together enough credits to graduate.
 
 I doubt that Palin knows enough geography to name the major oceans and continents of the world, not to mention a great many other things of which she is totally ignorant.
 
 Obama, on the other hand, contains so much information and knowledge in his head that it would be understandable if he misplaced a bite or two when he was tired.

The year before my son turned 18, he constantly pleaded to beallowed to a tattoo, but I refused to sign permission for one. Heargued that soon he would be a man and he should be able to makeadult decisions. Sure enough, a few days after his 18th birthday,he come home with a tattoo. Although I was riot happy about this,I was curious to see what symbol of masculinity he had chosen. There,on his shoulder, was a two-inch image of Mickey Mouse.
